meanings.sent1: The slimy, mucinous substance coated the surface of the leaf.
meanings.sent2: Her runny nose was a clear sign of a mucinous cold.
meanings.sent3: The mucinous texture of the glue made it tricky to stick the pieces together.
meanings.sent4: The pond looked like a mucinous swamp after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The mucinous consistency of the pudding made it hard to swallow.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or producing mucus.
meanings.sent1: The mucinous glands in the body help protect against infections.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the mucinous discharge was a normal bodily function.
meanings.sent3: The mucinous tissues in the body acted like a shield against harmful substances.
meanings.sent4: The mucinous layer on the skin kept it moisturized and healthy.
meanings.sent5: The mucinous nature of the substance made it ideal for lubrication purposes.
